meanings.definition: To form or cause small depressions or indentations on a surface.
meanings.sent1: She was dimpling the clay to create a textured effect.
meanings.sent2: The raindrops dimpling the puddles made a soothing sound.
meanings.sent3: The playful child was dimpling the playdough with joy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile dimpled her cheeks like a gentle breeze on water.
meanings.sent5: The golf ball dimpling the green grass was a satisfying sight.

meanings.definition: The act of creating small depressions or indentations on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The dimpling on the metal sheet added a unique pattern.
meanings.sent2: I noticed the dimpling on the surface of the cake.
meanings.sent3: The dimpling on the sand looked like tiny footprints.
meanings.sent4: The dimpling on the paper resembled a secret code.
meanings.sent5: The dimpling on the leather gave it a vintage look.
